attributes.action: set fuel duty at a fixed rate not percentage, only increasable at budget by a maximum of inflation rate and calculated to set fuel price at a maximum of £1 per litre for the first year
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: this petition is quite simple to understand rather than fuel duty set at a percentage of fuel price set it to a fixed fee per litre so therfore if fuel prices rise per barrel only the extra cost of the raw material is passed on to the pumps not the rise plus an extra few pence tax.to stablise this at budget make it only increasable at budget by the current inflation rate maximum.set fuel price to a maximum £1 per litre for petrol and diesel for the first year and auto gas a maximum of £0.40 per litre .this will stablise the cost  of all transport industry using road based vehicles thus stablising most produce prices

rejection.details: There are many similar petitions, see http://search.petitions.pm.gov.uk/kbroker/number10/petitions/search.lsim?qt=reduce+fuel&sr=0&nh=10&cs=&sc=number10&oq=abolish+fuel&sb=0&ha=1157&mt=0
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
